subject: AI
title: Choosing a Model
description: How to pick the right LLM for your task and budget.

hook.text: GPT-4, Claude 3, Gemini, Llama, Mistral ‚Äî dozens of models, all claiming to be the best. How do you actually choose?

buildup.text: Three dimensions matter: capability (how well it handles your task), cost (per token), and latency (response speed). No model wins on all three.

discovery.text: Start with the cheapest model that might work (GPT-4o mini, Haiku). Test on 50 examples. If quality is insufficient, move up. Don't start with the most expensive model.

twist.text: Benchmarks don't predict real-world performance. A model that ranks #1 on MMLU might rank #5 on your specific task. Your eval set is the only benchmark that matters.

climax.text: Build your system to swap models easily. The best model today might not be the best model next month. Provider lock-in is the real cost.

punchline.text: Test on your data, optimize for your budget, and keep the option to switch. That's the entire strategy.

quiz.question: What's the best approach to choosing an LLM for a new project?
options: Always use the largest, most expensive model
Start small, test on your data, and scale up only if needed
Use the same model for every task
